channel.title: CVE Feed for themeinwp -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for themeinwp -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-8790|2024-10-18T13:06:28.744Z -- themeinwp -- social%20share%20with%20floating%20bar
item.description: The Social Share With Floating Bar plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting due to the use of add_query_arg without appropriate escaping on the URL in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.3. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-2109|2024-08-01T19:03:38.341Z -- themeinwp -- booster%20extension
item.description: The Booster Extension plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.0 via the 'booster_extension_authorbox_shortcode_display' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to extract sensitive data including user emails

item.title: CVE-2024-2109|2024-06-06T13:59:10.472Z -- themeinwp -- booster%20extension
item.description: The Booster Extension plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Sensitive Information Exposure in all versions up to, and including, 1.2.0 via the 'booster_extension_authorbox_shortcode_display' function. item.title: CVE-2024-8790|2024-10-18T04:32:51.131Z -- themeinwp -- social%20share%20with%20floating%20bar
item.description: The Social Share With Floating Bar plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting due to the use of add_query_arg without appropriate escaping on the URL in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.3. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
